page.title: 04FARMING AT NETTLEDEN
page.content: FARMING:The farmer at Nettleden grows 250 acres of{wheat,}& also 50 acres of beans (animal feed) every 5 yrs since wheat takes goodness out of the soil. {Mixed farming}is suitable as the area is very hilly & woody.{Oilseed rape & {barley}are also grown, but wildlife destroys many CROPS.The farm consists of 350 acres, managed by 1 family.In autumn before seeding the farmer ploughs in 48 units of potash & phosphate.In spring, nitrogen & MCPA weedkiller is sprayed in. {LIVESTOCK:}30 sheep-Suffolk Cross (1-2lambs/yr),6 Hereford Cross cattle (beef). (Milk production cut due to EEC quotas). {MACHINERY:}Most is hired as it is very expensive to buy.For 100 acres farmers have:7 tractors,2 ploughs,1 manure sprayer,5 trailers,1 combine harvester (cost Â£60,000)
